section.name: What you (presumably) have
section.p: Beverly works between one or more Fedora repositories and an Apache Solr index.

section.name: What you will have to supply
section.p: Currently, the only way to use Beverly is by housing in in Apache Karaf, a powerful and full-featured OSGi container. Installing and running Karaf is outside the scope of this document, but excellent instructions are available here and the community is friendly!

Because Karaf allows of reusing the transitive dependency management power of Maven, but the Maven repository into which Beverly is developed is not public, you will want to have a running Maven repository available to you into which you can install the Beverly code, from which it will be deployed to your Karaf instance.
